alert.note: Alert for Jefferson Davis; Lawrence; Lincoln (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 8:25PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln, Lawrence and western Jefferson Davis Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 825 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oma, or 12 miles south of Pinola, moving southwest at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wanilla around 835 PM CDT. Monticello and Sontag around 840 PM CDT. Robinwood around 845 PM CDT. Topeka and East Lincoln around 855 PM CDT. Jayess around 900 PM CDT. Ruth around 905 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include New Hebron and Silver Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
